  • eta.util.gpt.cost_gpt

eta.util.gpt.cost_gptÔÉÅ

cost_gpt(prompt, avg_resp_len, preamble=None, examples=[], model='gpt-3.5-turbo', stop=None, max_tokens=2048, postprocessors=[], n_retries=2, tokenizer=GPT2Tokenizer(name_or_path='gpt2', vocab_size=50257, model_max_length=1024, is_fast=False, padding_side='right', truncation_side='right', special_tokens={'bos_token': AddedToken('<|endoftext|>', rstrip=False, lstrip=False, single_word=False, normalized=True), 'eos_token': AddedToken('<|endoftext|>', rstrip=False, lstrip=False, single_word=False, normalized=True), 'unk_token': AddedToken('<|endoftext|>', rstrip=False, lstrip=False, single_word=False, normalized=True)}))[source]ÔÉÅ

Estimate the cost of a given prompt from GPT.

Parameters:

  • prompt (str) ‚Äì The prompt to use for generation (coded as a ‚Äúuser‚Äù message).

  • avg_resp_len (int) ‚Äì The estimated length of a response from GPT for the given prompt.

  • preamble (str, optional) ‚Äì An initial prompt to give GPT as a ‚Äúsystem‚Äù message.

  • examples (list[tuple[str, str]], optional) ‚Äì A list of example pairs, each consisting of a ‚Äúuser‚Äù message and an ‚Äúassistant‚Äù response.

  • model (str, default='gpt-3.5-turbo') ‚Äì The model name to use for generation.

  • stop (list[str], optional) ‚Äì A list of stop sequences to use in generation.

  • max_tokens (int, default=2048) ‚Äì The maximum number of tokens to generate.

  • postprocessors (list[function], optional) ‚Äì A list of functions to apply to any generated content. If a postprocessor returns ‚ÄòNone‚Äô, then generation is retried, up to n_retries times. Otherwise, the final result after applying each function is returned.

  • n_retries (int, default=2) ‚Äì The number of times to retry if a postprocessor determines that a generation is invalid.

  • tokenizer (object, default=GPT2Tokenizer) ‚Äì The tokenizer used for estimating the number of tokens created from the prompt.

Returns:

The minimum and maximum estimated costs, respectively, based on the range of possible retries.

Return type:

tuple[float, float]
